Since everyone on TV now agrees that the Swiftboat ads should be condemned for being nothing but a pack of lies, should John Kerry condemn the movie, Fahrenheit 9/11, since a lot of people are saying that it is a bunch of lies?
 
 What do you think?
 
 For the people that said they would never watch the movie, I have attached a copy of the transcript. Michael Moore won't make a penny from your reading it. Maybe some of you can point out the lies, and show why John Kerry should condemn it.

actually, the issues raised in f911 are much more relevant, important and weighty to america's current situation than kerry's veteran activity over 35 years ago. again the flaw with all political campaigns: they NEVER deal with the real issues. i mean does america really fare better with a president that didnt do something notable 35 years ago than someone that did something attrocious 6 months ago? what kind of screwed up system is this? who gets paid to put that kind of garbage to the forefront of the media??

If John Kerry is of the opinion that F911 was a doctored up piece of propagandistic junk, then, yes Senator Kerry should denounce Mr. Moore and his movie. Of course one would almost have to consider such a move a flip flop since Mr. Moore was a guest at the DNC.

Hmm, so Bush thinks that the SBVT ads are false but Kerry thinks that F911 is true. That must be the difference.
 
 So, Bush must think that F911 is true too! 
 I'm sure he has seen the movie by now and he hasn't said ONE word about it.
 
 The funny thing is that the SBVT ads are critical of something that happened 30+ years ago. F911 is critical of the record of the man doing the very job that is in contention. 
 
 One lies about a man for things he said and did 30 years ago in an attempt to smear his character and one shows footage of things the current president did recently and is still doing to violate the trust of the people in order to educate them beyond what they see on TV.
